summary: Lawrence J. Delsa is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations based on payroll certifications and reports from 1977 and 1978. The documents list Delsa's name, position, and salary during the specified periods. These documents serve as administrative records of the committee's staffing and financial operations.
significance: Lawrence J. Delsa's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation, though the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents. His presence on payroll records confirms his contribution to the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
